document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of Chinese species of ground beetles of the subgenus Pseudoophonus (genus Harpalus) (Coleoptera: Carabidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of Chinese species of ground beetles of the subgenus Pseudoophonus (genus Harpalus) (Coleoptera: Carabidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Harpalus ( Pardileus ) hauserianus
Schauberger, 1929
: 191
. Type locality: "Yun-nan-sen" (=Kunming), Yunnan, China .
Harpalus ( Pseudoophonus ) disaogashimensis Huang
in
Huang & Zhang, 1995
: 113
, 116, syn. n. Type locality: Kunming, 1990 m , Yunnan, China .

Diagnosis . This species is extremely similar in external characters including apical spur of protibia not dentate at margins (Fig. 1 ) to
H. indicus
, but differs from it in greater number (four, more rarely three or five) of setigerous pores along posterior margin of metafemur and in structure of median lobe of aedeagus with a much shorter basal field “ a ” and with a peculiar medial folded formation “ c ” in the internal sac (
Figs 72 –77, 80– 81
); some specimens have a medial spiny patch in the internal sac (
Figs 78–79
). In addition, mesotarsomere 1 of male of
H. hauserianus
lacks adhesive vestiture underneath in contrast to that of
H. indicus orientalis
, which has such vestiture apically. Body length 9.2–12.9 mm .
Distribution . Known only from China : mainly the south-western part (Xizang, Yunnan, Guizhou, Sichuan, and Henan). The species is recorded here from Xizang and Guizhou for the first time.

Remarks . In the original description of
H. hauserianus ,
Schauberger ( 1929 )
did not mention any specimen of the type series as a type . Thence, based on the article 74.5 of the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature (
ICZN 1999
), the subsequent erroneous treatment of the male from "Yun-nan-sen" as a holotype by
Gusenleitner ( 1990 )
should be considered as a valid lectotype designation (
Kataev 2001
), because this specimen was selected from the type series and all other specimens of this series were mentioned by him as paratypes .

The status and distinctive characters of
H. hauserianus
were discussed by
Kataev ( 2001 )
. Based on the original description of
H. disaogashimensis
, he also proposed that this taxon seems to be conspecific with
H. hauserianus
. A more recent examination of the type series of
H. disaogashimensis
confirmed this proposition. Thus we treat the latter taxon as a junior synonym of
H. hauserianus .
